node.title: Adonis Celestine
node.authortitle: Senior Director and Automation Practice Lead
node.authorbio:
Adonis Celestine is Senior Director and Automation Practice Lead at Applause. In this role, Adonis helps Applause’s clients to take a customer-centric approach to quality as part of their quality engineering evolution. He is an expert in test data management and compliance, as well as automation tools including Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Tosca, UFT and Leapwork. Before joining Applause, Adonis was Associate Director and Lead Solutions Architect at Cognizant and held diverse quality engineering roles across the finance and telecommunications sectors, working for brands including Lloyds Banking Group, de Volksbank, DLL, Tele2 and Rabobank.

Adonis is an accomplished writer and public speaker. He is the author of “Quality Engineering: The Missing Key to Digital CX” (2022), “Continuous Quality: The Secret of the Pharaohs” (2021), which won the EuroSTAR Software Testing Award, and “As the World Turns: A Predictive Test Approach with Machine Learning” (2019). He has delivered speeches and keynotes at events including TestNet, Testdag, Testcon, EuroSTAR, Romania Testing Conference and Belgium Testing Days. Adonis regularly writes for multiple tech publications and his articles have been featured in AI Journal, Digital IT News and AT Today.

node.title: Bob Farrell
node.authortitle: Vice President of Solution Delivery and CX Practices
node.authorbio:
Bob Farrell, Vice President of Solution Delivery and CX Practices for Applause, is a technology executive with more than 20 years of experience establishing programs that help his customers deliver high quality digital experiences to their customers. Bob has helped hundreds of digital innovators build and implement market-leading digital quality programs, and views product quality as a competitive differentiator. He spearheads groundbreaking innovation as leader of the digital accessibility conformance, UX research, and inclusive design practices, and manages customer success within the high tech and financial services practices with Applause.

Prior to his work with Applause, Bob specialized in digital product management, launching products globally for the financial, digital marketing, and museum industries.

Bob graduated with summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa honors from the State University of New York at Buffalo. He also holds a graduate certificate in object-oriented computing from Montclair State University. In his free time, Bob enjoys skiing, playing tennis and following international affairs.

node.title: Maria Mondragon Marquez
node.authorbio:
Maria supports the Applause global sales team, providing technical expertise throughout the sales cycle to consistently help Applause customers achieve digital excellence. In addition, she has years of experience in customer relationship management. Both through work and personal life, Maria has extensive global travel experiences, which have added to her expertise in helping companies achieve excellence in localization and UX projects. She is bilingual and has strong communication, organizational and presentation skills in English and Spanish.

In addition, Maria has 11+ years of experience in the telecommunication industry, particularly in network quality testing of 2G, 3G, LTE/IMS, IoT, and 5G technologies - testing mobile apps on Android and iOS devices.

In her free time, Maria enjoys spending time with family and friends, going to the beach and travelling to new places.

See more about Maria on LinkedIn.

node.title: Agim Isufaj
node.authorbio:
Agim helps some of Northern Europe’s leading telecommunications brands to provide seamless digital experiences for their customers. Whether it's navigating new technologies, business models or product rollouts, Agim ensures mobile network operators release intuitive, responsive and error-free solutions that work optimally across diverse devices, geographies and use cases for all users. His expertise spans manual functional, UX, accessibility, payments and IoT testing.

Before joining Applause as a Major Account Manager, Agim spent 15 years working on complex customer requirements and building collaborative relationships across geospatial, infrastructure and financial services. For the UK market, he worked with organisations like the National Mapping Agency, National Rail and Royal Mail to develop and implement innovative digital solutions, focusing on macro- and micro-level issues that affected citizens at home and internationally. He also helped the world’s biggest global investment banks and financial institutions to implement SaaS solutions that drove key investment decisions and impacted financial markets across EMEA.

Agim holds a BA in Business and Finance from London Metropolitan University.

node.title: Jason Munski
node.authorbio: Jason finds purpose in helping brands define and achieve their inclusive business objectives. He's been known to deliver exceptional customer experiences along the way. He has over 20 years of experience delivering excellence to an ensemble of users and organizations alike. He's always humble, tells bad jokes, and loves his wife and twin daughters very much. Find out more about Jason on LinkedIn.

node.title: Matt Heusser
node.authorbio:
Matt Heusser is an Applause contributing writer. Matt is the Managing Director at Excelon Development, where he helps companies improve their software delivery capacity. Matt has 25 years of experience in software delivery. Matt co-organized the first Workshop on Technical Debt, the Workshop On Self-Education in Software Testing (WhOSE), Test Coach Camp, five test retreats, the Workshop on teaching Test Design (WhatDa) and served twice on the board of directors for the Association for Software Testing (AST).

Matt is probably best known for his lean software delivery series of methods and his writing. Matt was the Lead Editor for How to Reduce the Cost of Software Testing (Taylor & Francis 2011), and he has produced over two hundred podcasts with his show producer, Michael Larsen.

Matt was the 2014 recipient of the Most Influential Agile Test Professional Person (MAITPP) award, and 2015 Most Popular Online Contributor to Agile at the Agile Awards. Matt has earned credentials as a journalist via the Association of Journalists and Authors.

You can find Matt on Twitter or on his company homepage to see what he has been up to lately.

node.title: William Reuschel
node.authorbio:
William Reuschel has over 10 years of experience helping teams develop products that are accessible, inclusive and a delight to their customers. As an accessibility and inclusive design expert, he uses his technical knowledge to guide designers and developers to scalable and repeatable success. He holds a degree in computer science, a Web Accessibility Specialist certificate from the International Association of Accessibility Professionals and is a Certified Scrum Master.

William spent the formative years of his career with an advocacy organization working closely with assistive technology users to evaluate both the accessibility and usability of critical products and services for people with disabilities. Through this work, he developed an understanding not only of the impact of technology on an individual’s life, but also the power of technology to build a more inclusive future for everyone. William is passionate about sharing his experience and building empathy with product teams to realize his vision of a fully inclusive future.

node.title: Dave Denver
node.authorbio:
Dave is a senior solutions consultant for Applause. He supports customers and prospects by leveraging Applause solutions and its digital community to create tangible business value.

Dave joined Applause in September 2019, coming from a similar role in a company that specializes in mobile devices in the cloud for automated testing at scale. While in this role, Dave supported several finance organizations with scaled mobile automation strategies and increasing mobile release speed and quality.

Prior to working as a solutions consultant, Dave spent more than 10 years in the financial sector enabling Agile adoption, introducing DevOps concepts to teams while creating enterprise frameworks for DevOps solutions, and standing up SRE teams. Managing teams within these organizations and the adoption of new development techniques and technologies allowed Dave to gain an appreciation for ensuring quality throughout the development and release process.

Dave has a master’s degree in Computer and Network Assurance from Wilmington University. He has many hobbies and interests including being a Scoutmaster and SPCA volunteer. He resides in Middletown, Del., where you can hear his extremely loud cheering at his kids’ sporting activities.

node.title: Chris Malone
node.authorbio:
Chris Malone is the Chief Executive Officer and a board member at Applause. Chris joined Applause in 2013 and served as both chief financial officer and president, prior to his appointment as CEO. Chris has been instrumental in Applause’s growth and international expansion.

Prior to Applause, Chris worked at NTT Data, a top five global IT service provider, as the CFO of the North American business, responsible for financial oversight and operations of a billion-dollar operating unit. Chris took on that role after successfully exiting Keane to NTT Data in 2010. Prior to NTT Data, Chris held a number of leadership roles in finance, sales & operations. Chris began his career at KPMG and is a Certified Public Accountant.

Chris received his bachelor’s degree and MBA from Babson College in 2000. Chris serves as the Chair on the Babson College Advisory Board.

node.title: David Ruiz Hernandez
node.authorbio:
David Ruiz is a senior software engineer based in Lyon, France, with expertise in continuous delivery and automated quality gates. His passion is helping clients to release high-quality products faster.

After finishing his degree in Computer Sciences in Las Palmas de Gran Canaria in 2008, David started working in software development. However, he soon discovered that he enjoyed finding ways to break software more than he did building it. He went on to developed a skillset around bug finding and has worked in QA at companies such as BMW (Germany), 7Eleven (Australia) or Changi Airport (Singapore) just to name a few.

Now, David has shifted his focus from detecting bugs to preventing them from happening. Where bugs do arise, David works to ensure their minimal impact on the SDLC, thereby saving clients time and money.

Outside of work, David enjoys reading medieval fantasy novels, spending a day at the sea (either surfing or scuba diving), riding his motorcycle and discovering new restaurants with his partner.

node.title: Dmitrii Barbasura
node.authortitle: Open Banking and Payments Innovation Expert
node.authorbio:
Dmitrii Barbasura is the Chief Operating Officer at Fintech Galaxy. He manages Fintech Galaxy’s operations and organization of all business processes, leading the company’s strategic growth in MENA and globally. He majorly contributes to setting and meeting the company’s objectives, bringing best practices into an efficient operating system to achieve a healthy and sustainable development.

With a longstanding experience of over 20 years of bringing innovative technologies to the financial market, including digital banking, payment cards processing, open API development and data aggregation, Open Banking/PSD2, Dmitrii has set the strategy and direction of multiple businesses while modelling their culture and values. He dedicated his deep expertise and knowledge to open banking APIs development, building ground-breaking solutions.

With a background ranging from programming, IT up to digitalising various business processes, Dmitrii Barbasura is keen on finding cost-efficient solutions that fill the gap between businesses and financial data.

Dmitrii has shared his open banking expertise with central banks around the world including the Central Bank of Brazil, Central Bank of Romania, EBA, Bank of Greece, Bank of Italy, Central Bank of Spain, Central Bank of Bahrain, and many others. He is a member of the Forbes Finance Council, The Berlin Group, and the Financial Data & Technology Association and is permanently invited as a speaker at global events, such as Money 2020, Paris Fintech Forum, LendIt, and many others.

Prior to joining Fintech Galaxy, Dmitrii was the co-founder and CEO of Salt Edge Inc., where he built a world-renown company starting only from an idea, created its product vision, managed its launch and go-to-market strategies, and embraced Open Banking/PSD2 innovations. Before Salt Edge, Dmitrii was engaged in various projects, ranging from founding and developing a money management solution to working in technical roles for companies involved in Software Development and Online Sales.

Dmitrii holds a Bachelor of Engineering in Information Technologies from the Technical University of Moldova, as well as a Bachelor in Economic Science from the Modern Humanitarian Academy.

node.title: Adrian Garcia
node.authorbio:
As a solutions consultant for Applause, Adrian works hand-in-hand with clients around the world to understand their strategic business objectives and requirements, and align them to the appropriate Applause digital quality and feedback solutions. Adrian is passionate about helping customers ensure high quality for their websites, mobile apps, IoT products and digital experiences via Applause's fully managed crowdtesting services.

Adrian joined Applause in February of 2022. Before Applause, Adrian worked for ACTi Corporation as a technical services manager, where he oversaw a team that provided consulting and technical expertise for video surveillance products and solutions. He previously worked as a full-stack web developer at a startup in Taiwan and as a network quality engineer at TIGO in Honduras.

Adrian has dual bachelor’s degrees in telecommunications and electronics systems, and he also holds a master’s degree in information systems from the National Tsing Hua University in Taiwan. In his spare time, he enjoys traveling, outdoor activities, flying drones, watching movies and playing guitar. He has been living with his wife in Orange County, Calif. since 2016, where they enjoy sunny weather and beautiful beaches year round.

You can contact Adrian at agarcia@applause.com.

node.title: James McQuillin
node.authorbio:
James began his UX research career in 2017 and his experience includes individual contributor work as well as managing projects and global programs, building and supporting UXR and ResearchOps teams, and overseeing practice operations. As Sr. Manager of UX Research, James engages with clients and prospects to understand their needs, outline the capabilities of Applause' global UX Research practice, and collaborates to identify where and how Applause can best support or supplement client research needs and overarching business goals.

Prior to Applause, James worked in retail technology for some time, stacking dual bachelor's degrees in accounting and marketing and career-dabbling in both before connecting all the dots to start his own business of in-home technology teaching and training. From minor quirks to major issues, observing people struggle with technology was discouraging because technology is intended to improve, enhance, or simplify our lives. His efforts resulted in high impact for one individual at a time but was not scalable which then paved a path to the field of UX research.

Despite living in flat Florida, James loves disconnecting and getting out in nature, especially visiting national parks and hiking mountains. He is an avid fan of standup comedy and also enjoys traveling, video games and social party games, checking out local breweries, and vibing to hip hop, rock, metal, and reggae music.

node.title: Eva Stepkes
node.authorbio: Eva is Communications Consultant at PIABO PR. There she works in the Deep Tech unit for various clients in the fields of software development, data management and AI. Besides her work in PR she is active as a slam poet, host and organizer of literature events as well as instructor for creative writing and performance.

node.title: Helen Fernety
node.authortitle: Inclusive Design UX Consultant at Applause
node.authorbio:
Helen is an inclusive design UX consultant at Applause. She works with firms to ensure they are educated and enabled to pursue innovative technology projects, fueled by the concept of empathetic inclusiveness.

Helen joined Applause in July of 2021. Prior to joining, she worked in digital accessibility as a UX accessibility specialist at FedEx. In 2015, after volunteering at World Services for the Blind, she and a team created ShopABLED, a tech solution focused on improving long term health for people with different abilities by making online grocery shopping and delivery accessible.

Helen's interest in inclusive design started with her own dyslexia, which made schooling a challenge. Inspired by early relationships with people with cognitive conditions and Helen Keller's life, Helen became a graphic designer, and eventually, a UX designer and researcher. Her bonds with persons with disabilities gave her the gift of empathy which she credits as being a key motivator in her career in the inclusivity space.

Helen lives in Memphis with her husband and two cats. She's the proud mother of two amazing kids living in Portland and NYC. She enjoys entertaining friends, gardening and she dreams of traveling the world again in the near future.

You can contact Helen at hfernety@applausemail.com

node.title: Jennifer Maguire
node.authorbio:
Jennifer is the Senior Manager Corporate Communications for Applause. She is responsible for Applause's corporate communications efforts including analyst relations and activities, press releases, media relations, and thought-leadership articles, blog posts and social media. Jennifer works closely with Applause's executive, marketing, sales and people teams.

Prior to joining Applause, Jennifer held several marketing and communications roles during her tenure with Bentley Systems, an engineering software company - most recently as Corporate Communications Director and Customer Success Communications Director. She also previously worked with AAA Club Partners as Communications Manager for their automotive group, and then as a writer and Digital Content Manager for AAA World magazine. Prior to that, she served as Public Relations Specialist for the Brandywine Conservancy and River Museum of Art. In addition, Jennifer has taught college writing, communications and literature classes as an adjunct professor for nearly 15 years at 5 different colleges and universities.

Jennifer holds a master's degree in literature from Villanova University and a bachelor's degree in English communications from Albright College. She is also a certified yoga instructor and has taught yoga for more than 10 years.

Art aficionado, audio book lover, nature enthusiast and self-proclaimed student of everything, Jennifer and her husband reside in Pennsylvania. To contact her, please send an email to jmaguire@applause.com.

node.title: Shaun Foreman
node.authorbio:
Shaun is the principal program manager of accessibility at Applause. He strives to drive the Applause accessibility program to the highest quality, and constantly works to improve it.

Shaun joined Applause in January 2021. He previously worked at HCL as its group program manager of accessibility, where he ran a team of about 350 accessibility compliance auditors that worked on multiple projects across several companies. Prior to that, he spent 20 years at Microsoft as a test manager, mainly focusing on web technologies.

Shaun got into accessibility as a side project while working as a test manager. About 6 months into the project, he saw the significant positive effect accessibility compliance has on many people’s lives. What started as a project quickly became a passion. In his words, “I did some pretty cool stuff in my career, but when I talk to my grandkids about what I did in the tech world, I want to say how I was a part of teams that enabled people of all abilities to use every aspect of their computer and software.”

Shaun is a father of three amazing boys, and he resides in Seattle.

You can contact Shaun at sforeman@applause.com.

node.title: Paul Teasdale
node.authorbio:
Paul Teasdale is an Applause Testing Services Manager based in Yorkshire, United Kingdom, managing English-speaking project teams to deliver high-quality results to various customers. He has been working in quality assurance for over a decade and has experience spanning the media, telecommunications, entertainment, banking and retail industries. Prior to his promotion to Testing Services Manager at Applause, Paul spent five years within the uTest community, starting as a tester before progressing through to Team Lead and later Solutions Delivery Manager.

Paul holds a Bachelor of Science Degree in Computing from The Open University in addition to an HNC in Business and Finance from De Montfort University.

node.title: Nigel Wilson
node.authorbio:
As a Major Account Manager at Applause, Nigel is responsible for driving new business opportunities and onboarding UK customers in the gambling, entertainment, energy and telecommunications sectors. He has worked with leading companies to achieve their strategic goals, improve customer loyalty, reduce cost and expand globally.

Nigel has over 20 years of professional experience in the B2B technology space and holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Studies from the University of Ulster. He is a keen cyclist often to be found out of breath in the Yorkshire Dales. You can reach out to Nigel with any questions at nwilson@applause.com.

node.title: Ben Anderson
node.authorbio:
As the AI and Voice Lead at Applause, Ben Anderson is responsible for a virtual team of AI and Voice experts across some of Applause's largest accounts, along with leading the Global Sales Go-To-Market Program for the company's AI and Voice practices.

A veteran of the Sales organization at Applause, Ben works with global accounts where he evangelizes digital quality and crowd-powered feedback to provide the best possible customer experiences for some of the world's top brands.

node.title: Dana Prey
node.authorbio:
Dana is a Senior Product Marketing Manager for Applause. She establishes and drives the overall go-to-market strategy for Applause, and develops the voices of the customer, messaging, positioning, and sales enablement.

Dana joined Applause in June of 2021. She previously oversaw Test Management and Behavior-driven Development (BDD) solutions at SmartBear. Dana got her start in tech as a webmaster, writing HTML in a dark cubicle in the CNN.com newsroom in Atlanta. After a Peabody Award and Edward R. Murrow Award, she left the peach state and mild winters to attend the MBA program at Boston College, earning a dual specialization in Product & Brand Management and Marketing Analytics, and was the recipient of the Dean's Letter of Commendation.

Dana attended Villanova University for undergraduate studies, where she was a varsity athlete and is an avid Villanova basketball fan. She has spent time as an elite runner and currently races cyclocross. Dana resides in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom, with her spouse, two tiny humans, corgi, and a variety of chickens, ducks and guinea fowl.

node.title: Tom Warburton
node.authorbio: Tom is a sports data and online betting expert with 15 years of experience working across trading, product, operations, delivery, and commercial projects for major companies within the space. He is currently the COO of the Berlin-based esports data company GRID.

node.title: Annabel van Daalen
node.authortitle: EU Content Marketing Manager at Applause
node.authorbio: As Applause’s EU Content Marketing Manager, Annabel produces original content that strives to educate leading companies in the EU market on issues impacting their industry. She has formerly written content for institutions as diverse as the World Bank and the Government of Chile and has expertise on topics ranging from blockchain to open data. An experienced public speaker, Annabel formerly led the speaker programme at the world’s oldest free speech society, the Cambridge Union, where she interviewed high-profile individuals such as Hollywood director Oliver Stone. Annabel speaks English, German and Spanish and holds a first-class degree in Modern and Medieval Languages from the University of Cambridge.

node.title: Burton Deady
node.authortitle: Strategic Account Manager for Sports Betting & Gaming
node.authorbio:
Having been with Applause for over five years, Burton is currently responsible for driving new business opportunities and onboarding customers in the sports betting and casino space. In the last year, Burton has been working with Applause sales, delivery, marketing, legal, and creative teams developing a strategic business approach to ensure an efficient new business process with our customers.

Burton received his BA in professional sales and holds a minor in psychology and public policy from Bentley University, where he also played varsity baseball. He has always been intensely interested in both sports and the sports betting revolution - in the US and globally.

“I’m thrilled by the advancements we’ve made at Applause in providing such a valuable service for mobile sportsbook and casinos businesses. It’s amazing not just to witness, but be a part of as well. We’ll continue to expand and evolve alongside our partners through 2021 and into 2022. There’s so much more to come.”

You can contact Burton with questions at bdeady@applause.com

node.title: Mike Plachta
node.authorbio: Mike is a seasoned web & mobile apps technologist. He started his career as a software engineer and led a team at a Norwegian-based media company before joining Applause as a Solutions Engineer. With a team he built to focus on the EMEA market, Mike helps Applause's strategic customers to test their digital products "in-the-wild".

node.title: Greg Burnett
node.authortitle: Vice President and General Manager, Sales and Customer Success, Strategic Accounts
node.authorbio:
Greg is the Vice President & General Manager of Strategic Accounts at Applause. In his role as VP and GM, he serves as the executive sponsor and champion to help customers achieve their goals through partnership with Applause, with a special focus on the media and entertainment and fintech industries.

Greg joined Applause in September of 2017. He previously worked at ServiceSource as a Senior Director of Solution Consulting, where he helped customers to analyze their strategy, sales, and operational performance for recurring revenue. He also made recommendations to improve retention, upsell and cross-sell, as well as overall customer satisfaction.

Greg earned his MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management and his BS in Business Administration from North Carolina State University. Outside of Applause, Greg is an avid outdoor enthusiast. He loves to surf, hike, and camp with friends and family.

node.title: Colleen Russell
node.authorbio:
A self-proclaimed "swiss army knife," Colleen is the primary point of contact for our inside enterprise customers, providing testing strategy leadership for leveraging our SaaS solution and QA services.

Colleen came to Applause in October of 2018 as a Test Engineer before joining the delivery team in September of 2000. She previously worked as the Director of Marketing Services for LiveEdit, spearheading new product initiatives and managing channel partner relationships through the onboarding and implementation phase. Most notably, she partnered with the teams at Mindbody and IIN to create end-user training documentation and teaching best practices for social media and SEO as part of a business marketing strategy.

Colleen is a fierce advocate for the underdog and spent Covid quarantine helping small businesses adapt to thrive and building a fully-featured virtual school model for K-8 students. She lives in Rhode Island where she enjoys skiing, sailing, rescuing puppies and spending time with her husband, three kids and yellow lab.

node.title: Amy Reichert
node.authorbio:
Amy Reichert is a QA test professional with 20-plus years of experience. Amy has been a QA tester within a variety of software development teams. Amy has extensive experience in QA process development and planning, team leadership and management, and QA project management. She has worked with multiple types of software development methodologies including Waterfall, Agile, Scrum and Kanban, as well as customized combinations of each. Amy enjoys continuing to improve her software testing craft. She also writes about software development and testing topics.

In her spare time, Amy enjoys gardening, cat management and the great outdoors.

node.title: Mike McKethan
node.authorbio:
Mike has twenty-plus years of quality experience in roles that include: director of QA/QE, management of large testing projects, automation framework and solution architect, and pre-sales support. His passion is building and advancing quality within organizations that appreciate progressive concepts and best practices.

Mike joined Applause in December of 2020. Prior to this, he worked as director of consulting services at CGI in Austin, TX, an IT tech and services firm that is among the largest of its kind in the world. At CGI, among other duties, he defined agile test methodologies, architected several automation frameworks, built testing CoEs as part of an onshore/offshore delivery model, and has consulted with various companies across multiple industry verticals to help transform their QA/testing groups and approach into highly functioning Quality Engineers as part of an overall shift-left strategy.

Mike has a Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems from Texas Tech University. When he’s not working, Mike enjoys coaching football and other sports with his children, is an avid gamer, and a student of jujitsu.

node.title: Ole Polzin
node.authorbio:
Ole is a Marketing Associate at Applause. He graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Business Management from the Berlin School of Economics and Law and organized meet ups, round tables and conferences across Europe as an Event Associate at Applause. After a break as a freelance content writer, he returned to Applause to work as a content creator, event manager and campaign manager. Ole is an avid soccer fan, craft beer enthusiast and enjoys walking his Labrador.

You can contact him at opolzin@applause.com

node.title: Julia Zacharias
node.authortitle: SVP of EMEA Customer Operations & Accessibility Practice Lead
node.authorbio:
As SVP EMEA of Customer Operations, Julia oversees Solution Delivery, Testing Services, and Community Management in the EMEA region. In this role, she drives expansion, retention, operational excellence and continuous improvement in close alignment with Sales and Product. She also leads the European part of the global accessibility practice and helps clients create inclusive and legally compliant digital experiences for their end customers.

Julia has 15 years of experience leading large scale organizational transformations as a consultant at Kearney and project portfolio manager at Kion Group. She developed and led programs to drive operational excellence based on lean methods and enablement across all hierarchies, mainly for German 500 companies in the utilities, transportation and manufacturing sector. Earlier in her career, Julia worked as a public sector consultant focused on regional economic growth and industrial policy.

Julia holds a Master's Degree in Economics and Political Sciences from Freie Universität Berlin and has been a visiting student at Princeton University and Harvard University. She is a Certified Program Consultant for SAFe (Scaled Agile) and a Systemic Coach.

node.title: Mohammad Zaman
node.authorbio: As Sales VP of Strategic Accounts, Mohammad works closely with Applause's sales and delivery teams to help mobile network operators (MNOs), IoT and other large enterprise clients bring high-quality digital innovations to market by shifting left in the SDLC. Prior to Applause, Mohammad was involved in GSM, 3G, 4G and 5G network rollouts in the Americas in various sales management and technical roles. Over the last decade, he provided network quality monitoring and roaming test solutions to leading global MNOs to help them deliver outstanding mobile customer experience.

node.title: Florian Sasse
node.authorbio:
Florian is Communications Manager at PIABO PR in Berlin. There he works in the Deep Tech unit for various clients in the fields of software development, data management, cloud, AI and e-mobility.

Before joining PIABO, he worked, among others, at the PR agency Wilde & Partner Communications in Munich and at the sustainable music and culture festival Ilmpuls, where he set up the sponsorship department.

Florian holds a bachelor's degree in media and communication science from the Technical University of Ilmenau. In his free time he does a lot of sports and likes to try out new recipes of different cuisines.

node.title: Paul Hoffman
node.authorbio:
Paul is a communications professional with years of experience in roles ranging from internal/external brand communications, business partner communications, comarketing with large telcos, content marketing and sales enablement. He's worked for hardware, software, systems integration and consulting firms.

Prior to his current role at Applause, Paul worked as director, marketing content and communications for Symphony RetailAI, a software provider of solutions for global retailers, largely in grocery. The biggest chunk of his career was spent at IBM in various roles including sales enablement manager for Rational Software for Asia Pacific and Japan, and content strategist for the Always-On Newsroom, part of IBM Watson Commerce.

A highlight of his career was being selected to the IBM Service Corps where local community members and IBMers collaborate on economic and social challenges that face communities around the world. Paul served on a 12-person, international team in Indore, India. They worked to improve women's health issues in local slums.

When not contributing to his hand arthritis at the keyboard, Paul enjoys cycling, climbing/hiking and spending time with his family.

For more work background, visit his LinkedIn page.

node.title: Jared Rankin
node.authorbio: From his home in Seattle, WA, Jared uses his 13 years of experience in healthcare IT to help payer and provider organizations deliver digital experiences that will meet the rising expectations of consumers and serve as differentiators in the marketplace.

node.title: Bailey Apple
node.authorbio:
Bailey Apple is an Applause Senior Manager of Community and helps engage the global community of freelance software testers on uTest. Bailey has been with Applause since 2018 and has been working in community management for nearly 15 years.

Prior to joining Applause, Bailey worked with online communities ranging from fitness and nutrition fans, to global physicians, and now with freelance software testers. She is passionate about spotlighting success stories, building connections between community members, and highlighting all of the ways that testers can learn new skills, earn extra money and connect with others on uTest.

Bailey holds a bachelor's degree in Communications from the University of Massachusetts-Amherst, where she was a member of the Commonwealth College of Honors. When she is not working, Bailey enjoys painting, collaging, and traveling around New England.

node.title: Ido Rabinovitch
node.authortitle: Strategic Practices Leadership and Technical Evangelist
node.authorbio:
Ido is a software quality engineering executive with extensive experience helping companies and software organizations develop and continuously roll out high-quality products and features. His blend of professional and personal leadership skills assists him in guiding organizations to follow modern engineering practices with attention to the ultimate customer experience and digital journey. He currently works as a Senior Director at Applause leading strategic practices. Ido is also the Applause Technical Evangelist and blog contributor.

Ido has years of experience building and leading multiple quality engineering organizations and strategic practices for top-tier enterprises, driving exceptionalism across all team members. He particularly enjoys inspiring others to constantly improve and attain their full potential. He is skilled in evolving development, product and quality organizations into modern software engineering shops, influencing all levels of the company with a Lean-Agile and DevOps mindset and principles.

Prior to working at Applause, Ido was Director of Software Engineering at AT&T; Sales Director and Director of Software Quality Engineering at Amdocs; and Director of Quality Engineering at Tescom. Ido is also a certified Project Management Professional and a certified SAFe Agilist.

Ido has a passion for cultivating and driving exceptional software quality practices with specialties in test automation, continuous improvements, built-in-quality, test-driven development and shift-left methodologies.

When he is not working, Ido enjoys spending weekends with his wife watching their sons play soccer, snowboarding during the winter, cooking special meals, listening to live music, and traveling globally.

node.title: Ronja Jedro
node.authorbio:
Born and raised in Hamburg, Germany, Ronja (rhymes with Sonia) is a multilingual copywriter with a focus on digital products. With a background in Business Administration and a knack for words, she has helped brands in a range of industries to communication successfully with their audience. She writes in German and English and only needed a decade and a half to become a fluent Mandarin speaker. In her free time, she likes to run marathons, indulge in Asian cuisine and ponder which language to learn next.

If you have any questions, you can contact her at info@lindgren.world or on Linkedin.

node.title: Cathy Huang
node.authorbio:
Cathy Huang works as the Applause Product Director, focusing on driving product strategy and innovation. She specializes in the fields of automation strategy, artificial intelligence, and functional quality assurance testing.

Cathy graduated from Massachusetts Institute of Technology with a degree in Management Science. Prior to Applause, Cathy worked at Verb as Director of Product for their leadership development platform. She also held a position at Amherst Holdings as Senior Project Manager focusing on projects related to real estate and finance. With over a decade of experience in various roles at software companies, she is a champion of the voice of the customer and is constantly looking for new ways to improve the customer experience with behavioral science.

Cathy also shares her product management expertise as a writer and content creator. She has been a featured guest on the SoftwareTestPro Podcast, STP Radio. In addition to creating thoughtful content around product management and digital quality for Applause, Cathy’s work has been included in publications such as the SD Times. In her free time, Cathy loves spending time with her border collies.

node.title: Kerry Garvey
node.authorbio:
Kerry Garvey is an Applause Testing Services Manager based in East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom, managing English speaking project teams to deliver high-quality results to various customers. Kerry has been working in quality assurance for over 15 years, covering a wide range of industries. Before becoming a Testing Services Manager for Applause, Kerry spent over 7 years within the uTest community, starting as a tester and progressing through to Team Lead and on to Testing Services Manager.

Kerry earned a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Social Science (and English Literature) at York University, focusing on Media Studies and Globalization.

node.title: Zeb Winzenried
node.authorbio: Zeb is a Director in Applause's Testing Services organization, focusing on Payments. Zeb manages the delivery of Testing Requests with a global team, focused primarily on some of the largest Payment Testing customers at Applause. Zeb began his career at Applause when he went from stay-at-home dad to full time software tester. He found projects dealing with the payment landscape to be a challenging and fascinating space. Zeb fused his background in business management with his love of technology, dedicating his time to these projects. His passion and drive in the field allowed him to rise through the ranks of Applause quickly, from tester to Test Team Lead, then Test Architect to now a Director of Testing Services. Zeb is currently based in San Antonio, Texas, and has been helping to successfully grow Payment Testing at Applause since 2015.

node.title: Carlton Retland
node.authorbio: Carlton is the Principal Solutions Engineer for Applause’s Customer Journey Testing solution. Carlton works closely with organizations to understand their customer journey maps and understand how Applause can help them test their customer journeys across multiple touchpoints. Carlton is based in Washington D.C. and has been with Applause since 2016.

node.title: John Kotzian
node.authorbio:
John Kotzian is an Applause Test Architect and manages global teams of testers to deliver quality results to many industry-leading organizations. John has been with Applause for over a decade and has been working in quality assurance testing for over 20 years.

John worked at Borders for many years starting in inventory management. John would eventually graduate to a role as Senior Quality Assurance Analyst. John was also a member of the uTest community and experienced first-hand the role of an Applause tester. Before becoming a Test Architect for Applause, John spent nine years participating in and becoming a leader within the uTest community.

In his personal life, John is an accomplished historian and author. John specializes in the maritime history of the Great Lakes. He wrote, "Sky Pilot of the Great Lakes", published in 2014. John also co-authored "Birds and Beacons of Michigan" with Kimberly Kotzian, which was released in 2020.

node.title: Andreea Mandeal
node.authorbio:
Andreea Mandeal has been working in marketing for B2B tech companies for 7 years. As the senior customer marketing manager, Andreea aligns customer stories to Applause thought leadership, product messaging, and campaigns.

She communicates on the success of Applause's clients through the creation of customer case studies, video testimonials, webinars, speeches at conferences, and awards submissions. She handles customer advocacy, PR, and at times content marketing and sales enablement.

Last but not least, she's the one behind DigitalXChange, the go-to event brand for passionate product people all around Europe. This is her favorite "product", on which she worked for 2 years and a half. This gives her the unique opportunity to constantly learn from top product leaders, network, and help others network and improve. Previously, she worked for Market Logic Software, an AI insights platform, where she set up the marketing team from scratch. Andreea is passionate about product management, technology, and digital transformation.

She earned her BA and Masters in Philosophy from Universidad Complutense de Madrid and a BA in International Business (major in Marketing) from Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin. In her free time, Andreea likes traveling, reading, cooking, and dancing to 80s music.

node.title: Constantin Büker
node.authortitle: Senior Director, Testing Services EU at Applause
node.authorbio: Working at Applause since 2014 and in the crowdsourcing field since 2012, Constantin Büker is leading the Testing Services department in the EU at Applause in Berlin and dedicated much of his time to establishing crowdtesting on the European market in the past few years - by identifying and harnessing the tangible added value for companies and designing a new working landscape for the people around the globe who decide to become part of the crowd. Through his role at Applause, Constantin gets to explore the latest technological developments, cultural diversity and actively shape ideas and markets. He enjoys sharing his knowledge and skills through writing articles.

node.title: Marina Lucier
node.authorbio:
Marina Lucier came to Applause in 2019 as a business development representative. Marina has since moved to the Applause marketing team. She assists in developing content and maintaining marketing campaign operations.

Previous to working in technology Marina had roles in the non-profit industry. She led fundraising and petition-signing efforts for GreenPeace San Diego.

Marina began her career in technology in 2017 as a marketing intern for PowerSchool, a global leader in education technology. She performed customer outreach and created internal content to support the sales team.

node.title: Luke Damian
node.authorbio:
Luke is the Chief Growth Officer at Applause. He owns the go-to-market strategy for the company, including its marketing and sales operations functions.

With a focused eye on accelerating growth, Luke brings 20+ years of operating experience to Applause from national leadership positions at Oracle and EMC. During his tenure with Oracle, he led sales, business development and customer success initiatives across multiple growth priorities including solution development, strategic customer acquisition and engagement, and customer retention programs. Earlier in his career, Luke held significant roles at EMC serving in various leadership positions across sales and business development.

Luke holds an MBA and a BS from Babson College. He also earned an Executive Certificate in Strategy and Innovation from MIT’s Sloan School of Management.

node.title: Eran Kinsbruner
node.authorbio:
Eran Kinsbruner is an Applause contributing writer. Eran is a software engineering professional with nearly 20 years of experience at companies such as Sun Microsystems (Oracle), General Electric, Texas Instruments, NeuStar and Matrix.

He is an author of two books, The Digital Quality Handbook and Continuous Testing for DevOps Professionals. Eran is also a monthly columnist at the Enterprisers Project. He holds various industry certifications from ISTQB, CMMI, and others. Eran is a recognized software web and mobile testing influencer and thought leader, as well as an experienced speaker in the major software engineering conferences. He is also a researcher, blogger, and a patent-holding inventor for a test exclusion automated mechanism for mobile J2ME testing. He can be found all over social media, including on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and his professional blog.

Eran has spoken about automation and continuous development at events such as StarEast, StarWest, DevOps East/West, Quest, STPCon, AutomationGuild, AndroidSummit, TISQA, TestExpo UK.

node.title: Thomas Komar
node.authorbio:
Thomas Komar worked at Applause as an intern supporting the product, revenue, and corporate marketing teams. Thomas graduated from Bentley University in 2020. He has also held internships with companies such as Otis Elevator as an Environmental and Health Safety Intern. He also worked at United Technologies as an HR Robotics Press Automation Intern. Recently Thomas has taken on an internship at Form Labs as a Marketing Operations Intern.

Thomas has also participated as an Adobe Group Student Ambassador Leader. He managed a team of students to develop and execute a marketing plan promoting Adobe's Creative Cloud platform.

Thomas is also an active volunteer in his community. He works with the Special Olympics as a Bowling Supervisor. He has also volunteered with Harvest House and the Letter Carriers Food Drive.

node.title: Jonathan Zaleski
node.authortitle: Sr. Director of Engineering & Head of Applause Labs
node.authorbio:
Jonathan Zaleski is a highly skilled, versatile and reliable technical leader with a demonstrated history of working in the internet industry. He has more than 15 years of engineering and technology experience across multiple verticals and platforms. Jonathan is a polyglot skilled in software development, scalability and Agile methodologies who uses his breadth of knowledge and skill to get the best out of his team. He is a dedicated leader who continuously strives for excellence.

As the senior director of engineering at Applause, Jonathan and his team build best-in-class software with an eye toward innovation and next-generation concepts. They work to improve the capabilities of the Applause Platform, using cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning to make the company more efficient.

Most recently, Jonathan held several engineering leadership roles at Wayfair. Prior to that, he was a principal software engineer at Sermo. He earned his Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) focused in Computer Science, Environmental Science & Math from Westfield State University.

node.title: David Carty
node.authorbio:
David is a senior content manager for Applause. In coordination with Applause’s product, solutions consultants and community teams, David creates and edits engaging content, including blog posts, case studies, whitepapers and webinars.

David joined Applause in November of 2020. He previously worked as a site editor at TechTarget in Auburndale, Mass., where he created and managed editorial content for SearchSoftwareQuality.com. He co-hosted the site’s award-winning Test & Release podcast. In recognition of his efforts, David was named TechTarget’s Editor of the Year in 2020.

Prior to becoming a technology writer and editor, David began his writing career as a sports journalist. David won awards from the New England Newspaper & Press Association for his sports writing and design as a sports reporter at the Sun Chronicle in Attleboro, Mass and sports editor of the Foxboro Reporter in Foxboro, Mass. He previously worked as a sports content producer for KWTV, the CBS affiliate in Oklahoma City.

David has a bachelor’s degree in journalism from Emerson College. He is an avid reader, writer and film buff – not to mention a husband and father of two. He resides in Weymouth, Mass.

You can contact David at dcarty@applause.com.

node.title: Jennifer Waltner
node.authorbio:
Jenn is the Global Content Marketing Manager for Applause. She leads a team responsible for a variety of content including blog posts, case studies, ebooks, webinars, white papers, and more.

Before joining Applause in late 2020, Jenn spent 10 years in content marketing and demand generation roles for global software companies Aspen Technology and Skillsoft, multi-channel marketing services firm Harte Hanks and marketing training provider MarketingProfs. She started her marketing career at Rivier College (now University) planning fundraising campaigns.

Jenn holds a bachelor’s in English and communications from Notre Dame College and a master’s in writing and literature from Rivier. She is the sole proprietor of a specialty retail business. When Jenn’s not working, fulfilling e-commerce orders or bringing fresh inventory to her shop microsites in Salem and Lowell, Massachusetts, she enjoys reading, cooking, and learning to play guitar.

node.title: Dan Cagen
node.authorbio:
Dan is a Product Marketing Manager for Applause, and is responsible for launching Applause’s new solutions and products on an ongoing basis. Dan is responsible for ensuring consistent messaging and positioning across all of Applause’s leading testing and digital quality offerings. Dan works closely with Applause’s Sales, Product, Marketing, Delivery, Solutions Consultants and Community teams.

Previously, Dan was Applause’s Global Content Marketing Manager, and was responsible for all of Applause’s public-facing content, including blog posts, case studies, white papers and webinars.

Prior to joining Applause in September 2019, Dan served as a Marketing Manager in the Content and Programs Online Marketing department at TechTarget, based in Auburndale, Massachusetts. Dan helped promote and evaluate organizations’ content used in lead generation campaigns, helping them to hone their messaging to best connect with their audience. Dan also previously worked in TechTarget’s editorial department, building content for TechTarget’s data center, server virtualization, cloud computing and Windows Server websites.

Dan began his writing career as a sports journalist at the MetroWest Daily News in Framingham, Massachusetts. He covered the Boston Bruins for four seasons as well as local high school sports in the Framingham area.

Dan has a bachelor’s degree in communications from Boston College and a master’s degree in marketing analytics from Bentley University. Dan is a cinephile and has a goal of watching 50 new movies every year. He currently resides in Medford, Massachusetts.

If you have any questions, you can contact Dan at dcagen@applause.com

node.title: Hamish Sherlock
node.authorbio: As the Director of Solution Consulting at Applause, Hamish and his team work hand-in-hand with clients to understand their needs and align their requirements to the appropriate Applause solutions. Prior to Applause, Hamish worked in technical roles at Micro Focus, Compuware and Segue Software.

node.title: Richard Downs
node.authorbio: Richard has 30 years of experience delivering solutions to client problems, from business intelligence to collaborative supply chains, from e-commerce to user experience & customer journey mapping, and more recently in the innovative world of digital quality. He has a knack of understanding what customers need and then helps deliver the required solution to drive maximum value for the customer. At Applause, he is responsible for understanding the needs of UK clients and shaping meaningful solutions. Prior to Applause, Richard was a Senior Director at ServiceSource helping clients drive top-line revenue growth, prior to that he was leading the e-commerce and social media platform team at Infosys working with many of Europe's leading retailers and banks

node.title: Chris Sheehan
node.authorbio: As VP of Strategic Accounts at Applause, Chris is responsible for developing and executing the company's retention and expansion programs for North America Enterprise customers. Prior to his role in Customer Success, Chris led Applause's long-term Product Strategy team. He currently serves on the boards of Xconomy and CWE and has led many investments in the Boston area as a software VC.

node.title: Camille Charlier
node.authorbio:
Camille worked at Applause as Content Marketing Manager between 2018 and 2021. She was in charge of producing and publishing high-quality content in English and French through various channels, covering topics such as agile product development, digital quality, CX, digital transformation and innovation. She was also responsible for running Applause's webinars program in the EU, working with various clients and partners.

She completed a Bachelor's Degree in applied communications and a Master's Degree in public relations and media at IHECS in Brussels, Belgium. During her studies, she completed a specialization in knowledge and innovation management as well as specific training programs in web design and front-end web development, photography, and video production.

Prior to working at Applause, she worked as a Community and Marketing Manager in an early-stage startup in Berlin, Germany. She is passionate about B2B content marketing, tech, design and photography.

node.title: Rob Mason
node.authorbio:
Rob Mason has more than 20 years of operational, management, and software development experience across various companies, languages, platforms and technologies. A meticulous builder and obsessive tester, Rob’s teams produce innovative, robust software.

Prior to Applause, Rob was founder and executive vice president of engineering at Nasuni, where he took the company from initial product concept to more than 10 petabytes of managed storage consisting of billions of files in a global file system. Prior to Nasuni, Rob oversaw all development and quality assurance as the VP of engineering at Archivas.

Rob holds over 30 patents including several in the area of test automation. He has a Bachelor of Science degree from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and an MBA degree with honors from Rutgers University. Rob lives on a horse farm in Massachusetts with his wife.

node.title: Kelly McCann
node.authorbio:
Kelly McCann is a Senior Product Marketing Manager at Applause. Kelly has over five years of Product Marketing experience across various industries. She is Pragmatic Marketing certified and applies that framework in her current role.

At Applause, Kelly is responsible for managing the marketing efforts across Applause’s core testing solutions. She creates a wide range of sales collateral to communicate Applause’s key messaging to our core buyer personas. Kelly works closely with the Sales team to ensure they are trained and well-equipped in the field. She is also responsible for launching new Applause solutions and offerings into the market. Kelly works collaboratively with Product Management to define the core features and benefits of a new offering and is responsible for defining the market positioning and the overall go-to-market strategy. Most recently this includes the launch of Applause’s new Integrated Functional Testing solution and launch of the Applause Accessibility Tool.

Kelly joined the Applause team in July 2018 after holding product marketing roles at GasBuddy and Upromise by Sallie Mae. She earned her Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a focus in Marketing from Stonehill College in Easton, MA. Outside of work, Kelly enjoys traveling, outdoor activities and checking out local craft breweries.

node.title: Jaime González
node.authorbio:
Jamie Gonzalez has over ten years’ experience in IT sector in software programming and hardware integration fields in addition to over four years of experience in quality assurance and testing. Jamie has contributed his expert knowledge of developing and testing web and mobile applications to the Applause blog.

As an Applause Test Engineer Jamies leads a wide range of projects in the Spanish and global-LatAm markets. He manages and workes with testing teams to build a positive job culture and improve overall results for all stakeholders. Jamie and his teams help customers to design and deploy their testing strategy to create digital solutions in a variety of applications such as banking, finance management, e-commerce, tourism and cloud backup. Jamie has also been recognized by Applause and the uTest community with the ‘Outstanding Tester’ award.

node.title: Emerson Sklar
node.authorbio:
Emerson Sklar is a former Applause employee. During his time at Applause, Emerson worked as a Senior Solution Architect. He helped to found and launch Applause voice solutions and would become Applause Director of Voice Solutions. Emerson Sklar is currently employed as Chief Evangelist for Bespoken.

Over the years Emerson has contributed his expertise in automation and voice technology to numerous publications. Examples include “Creating Superior Customer Experiences - The Challenge for Connected Cars” published by Automotive World and “The Future of Healthcare? Voice.” which was published by Health IT Outcomes. Emerson was a keynote speaker in 2018 at VOICE Summit, as well as a contributing speaker at Voice.Health 2018.

In his free time, Emerson is an active volunteer member of the Boy Scouts of America and serves as a Youth Camp Counselor. In addition to his volunteerism, Emerson enjoys cooking overly elaborate meals through science and adventure cycling when he is not working.

node.title: Peter Basile
node.authorbio: My philosophy is data drives creativity. As a full-stack digital marketer with 12+ years’ experience in B2B/ B2C environments, I pride myself on differentiating and accelerating the growth of brands, at home and around the world. With proven experience defining and driving strategies that strengthen revenue and competitive market position worldwide, I have a track record for identifying growth opportunities and designing and executing impactful, integrated marketing programs that deliver results.

node.title: Yasmin Diekmann
node.authorbio: Yasmin is Account Manager at Oracle. At oracle she supports retail clients with bringing their customer experience to the next level. She has great experience in digital transformation in the field of retail. Yasmin studied Global Management and acquired a broad range of skills in business, economics, and intercultural management. For the past 3 years she’s been working within the tech industry and advocates digital transformation in business and society. Yasmin has unique insights into how digital transformation is changing culture and customer experience.

node.title: Drew Horn
node.authorbio:
Drew Horn joined Applause in 2015 as a Senior Manager of Automation Delivery and would become the Senior Director of Automation during his time at the company. Drew contributed several articles to the Applause blog which share his knowledge of automated quality assurance.

Drew graduated from The University of Texas at Austin in 2006 where he studied mathematics and computer sciences. He launched a side project called Pivit in 2013. As CTO and co-founder of Pivit, Drew became highly experienced in developing digital platforms. He learned the ropes of quality assurance as a QA engineer and manager of QA platforms at Trustwave before coming to Applause. He also worked as Senior Manager of Development Operations at Amherst Holdings. Currently, Drew is Director of Business at Sumo Logic, a cloud-based machine data analytics company focusing on security operations based in Redwood City, California.

node.title: Chris Munroe
node.authorbio:
Chris Munroe is the Vice President of Testing Services and Community at Applause. With a background in Agile methodologies, test automation, quality assurance, and enterprise software.

Chris has a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Chris is one of Applause’s longest-tenured employees, having joined the company in 2012 in a sales engineering capacity. In his current role, Chris oversees Applause’s testing services and community. Prior to joining Applause, Chris worked as the Global Head of QA at BT Conferencing.

node.title: Jean-Pierre Lambert
node.authortitle: Writer, Speaker about Agile Quality - Creator of Scrum Life
node.authorbio:
Jean-Pierre Lambert comes from a background as a software developer with a strong interest in quality and business value. Jean-Pierre has helped teams grow, overcome challenges, deliver awesome products and delight customers as an Agile and Quality Assurance Coach. He often contributes his expertise to the Applause blog as a writer.

Jean-Pierre also shares his thoughts and experiences on his personal blog and at various conferences and meetups. He works to educate others on Agile practices and mindset through his YouTube channel and his famous Scrum Life show.

node.title: Lars Markull
node.authorbio:
Lars Markull is an experienced consultant working in the Financial Service industry for more than ten years. He specializes in Open Banking, Banking-as-a-service, Fintech APIs and infrastructure topics. He has published several articles with Applause about developing top-quality finance apps and products.

Lars graduated with a Master’s degree from Purdue University Krannert School of Management. Previously, he worked at Figo as Head of Business Development and was responsible for non-bank sales, the developer community and business development. As a Financial Services Contractor Lars has worked with organizations such as the leading German fintech newsletter, Finletter, and Open Bank Project.

Lars has also hosted and organized seven Fintech hackathons between 2015-2019 with he organization Bankathon. Bankathon developed into one of Europe's biggest FinTech hackathons.

node.title: Jay Selig
node.authorbio:
Jay worked as a Content Marketing Manager for Applause. He joined the Applause team in March 2018. While at Applause Jay was a frequent contributor to the blog.

Jay graduated from the University of Maryland with a Bachelor’s degree in marketing and supply chain management. Jay is also certified by DigitalMarketing as a content marketing specialist. Jay worked Brightline Interactive as a Marketing Manager. Jay also worked at Red Peg Marketing as a Marketing Manager. He spent time managing internal communications for Marriott International before coming to Applause.

Jay has since worked as Content Strategy Manager at InsightSquared. His content has been published by organizations such as Adweek, Convince & Convert, VentureBeat, and MediaPost

node.title: Dan Rowinski
node.authorbio:
Dan Rowinski joined Applause in 2014 as founder and Editor-in-Chief of a publication called ARC - The Application Resource Center. ARC was a digital magazine focused on the production of mobile apps and innovations in digital engagement and economics.

Dan was hired as a Senior Editor at MIT Horizon. MIT Horizon is an initiative under MIT open learning. In his spare time, Dan writes science-fiction stories. His first book is titled, The Starving Bachelor. Dan also continues to contribute to the Boston sports industry as a freelance writer. Additionally, Dan has appeared in the Boston Globe, Business Insider, and Government Computer News. He has also been featured on the podcast, “Boston Speaks Up” which is presented by Boston Business Journal’s BostInno.

node.title: David Bolton
node.authorbio:
David Bolton is a writer with over twenty years of experience. While with Applause, David worked as a content creator and key contributor to The Application Resource Center (ARC). ARC was a digital magazine sponsored by Applause.

David has extensive experience writing on the subject of technology. He published a weekly gaming article with BostonInno in 2010. After Applause, he became a Senior Writer for Greenhouse Insights which is a marketing firm specializing in the AR/VR industry. David has worked as a freelance writer and independent contractor with companies such as Brafton Inc. Most recently he is working as a content creator at ETQ. In addition to technology, David has experience writing on the topics of sport, gaming, entertainment and media studies. He is originally from London, England.

node.title: Laura Gray
node.authorbio:
Laura Gray joined Applause in January of 2016 as a product marketing associate. While at Applause she contributed articles about the partnerships built with Applause customers.

Laura graduated from Northeastern University with a degree in International Business.. During her education, she studied abroad in France. Laura gained experience as an intern at Consensus Interactive. Laura would go on to become a Business Operations Specialist at Fisku before moving to Applause.

Since then she has worked as a Marketing Content Manager at Ciclismo Classico, a company that provides European bike tours. In 2017 she was hired as a Marketing Specialist at Pegasystems. Recently, Laura has been working with Skyword as a Senior Professional Services Manager. Skyword is a media and advertising company based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Laura serves as the President of the Board of Directors for the CommonWheel bicycle collective. In her spare time she has also worked with the Big Sisters Association of Greater Boston

node.title: Scott Siegler
node.authorbio:
Scott Siegler worked at Applause as a Product and Content Marketing Associate. During this time Scott was a regular contributor to the Applause blog.

Scott graduated from Wake Forest University with a degree in Business and Enterprise Management - Marketing and a Minor in Journalism. He interred with companies such as Boehringer Ingelheim and Sam’s Club. Before coming to Applause Scott worked as a Business Development Consultant at Oracle. Since that time he has been employed as Marketing Content Manager for MineralTree. Currently, he is Director of Marketing and Communications for the Boys and Girls Club of Boston.

Scott is also an avid volunteer. In addition to his work with the Boys and Girls Club of Boston, he has participated in volunteer programs with the YMCA and the Melrose Alliance Against Violence.

node.title: Mark Lapole
node.authorbio:
Mark Lapole is a product manager specializing in digital accessibility. In 2017 Mark was the Senior Product Manager and Ambassador for Accessibility at eBay. He teamed up with Applause to published articles about eBay and Applause partnering up to improve digital accessibility.

Mark attended Lebanon Valley College. In his early career, he worked as a web developer and UI designer for companies such as TEKSystems, United Messaging and IKON Office Solutions. In addition to working at eBay Mark was the Lead Accessibility and UX Designer at Thomson Reuters. Most recently Mark worked at Google as Accessibility UX Lead, Google Suite.

Mark volunteers with the Santa Clara Valley Blind Center and the Vista Center for the Blind and Visually Impaired

node.title: Daniel Fidler
node.authorbio:
Daniel Fidler specializes in customer marketing and managing customer success teams. While at Applause Daniel worked as Customer Marketing Manager and contributed to the writing of the Applause digital magazine, and blog.

Daniel graduated from Stonehill College in 2011 with a degree in Marketing. While at Stonehill Daniel participated in Track and Field, and Cross-country. He gained experience as Global Customer Marketing Manager for Mimecast, a cybersecurity provider based in London.
Daniel now works as a Senior Customer Success Manager for GreatHorn. GreatHorn’s main office is located in Waltham, Massachusets. GreatHorn was founded in 2015 and provides organizations with email security and cybersecurity solutions.

node.title: Bradley Batchelder
node.authorbio:
As Chief People Officer at Applause, Bradley is passionate about building inclusive cultures, embracing innovation and creating memorable employee experiences. He has helped Applause earn its reputation as a high-growth company by cultivating a diverse culture. As a result, Applause is consistently recognized as a top place to work both locally and globally by organizations like Inc. Magazine, Boston Business Journal and the Boston Globe.

Along with building a culture of collaboration, Bradley makes supporting Applause’s surrounding community a priority. Applause’s volunteer and fundraising efforts have been recognized by the United Way with awards including the Live United Award and the Good Neighbor Award.

Prior to joining Applause, Bradley held roles in recruiting and talent acquisition at Monster and Enterprise Search.

node.title: Jan Wolter
node.authortitle: SVP of Product & General Manager, Applause EU
node.authorbio:
As SVP of Product and General Manager at Applause EU, Jan leads our product organization and sets the strategic roadmap. Partnering with Engineering, his organization ensures we build solutions that address ongoing key customer business challenges. In addition, Jan leads European operations. As such, he ensures that Applause Europe meets its revenue and customer acquisition goals while maintaining the highest levels of quality and customer satisfaction.

Before joining Applause, Jan was CEO and co-founder of Testhub, which was acquired by Applause in May 2014. Jan has long supported companies from different sectors in implementing and scaling innovative software testing solutions for years before joining Applause.

Jan holds a Master of Science degree from London School of Economics and a Bachelor of Science degree from University of Mannheim, Germany.

node.title: Inge De Bleecker
node.authorbio: Inge has been designing and testing web, mobile, voice and multi-channel experiences for more than 20 years. She builds and leads UX teams and evangelizes customer experience principles throughout organizations. Her mantras are "design for everyone" and "test early and often." As Sr. Director of User Experience at Applause, Inge heads up the UX/CX practice. She holds an MA from the University of Texas, Austin.

node.title: Doron Reuveni
node.authorbio:
Doron Reuveni is the​ Executive Chairman of the Applause Board of Directors. Previously, Doron was the​ Chief Executive Officer​ and​ Co-Founder of Applause.

Doron found​ed​ Applause (formerly uTest) in 2007​ and ​led the creation of the crowdtesting market and ​its ​growth as market leader. ​Although the idea of “in-the-wild” software testing was a radical notion when Applause was founded, today, it has become an integral part of the software development process for thousands of companies worldwide.

Under Doron’s leadership, Applause evolved into an enterprise-grade solution, meeting the complex requirements of the world’s most influential brands. ​​Doron’s leadership has made him an internationally recognized expert in software development, testing, and entrepreneurship.

Doron earned a degree in Computer Science and Information Systems Engineering from the Technion University in Israel. Doron is an avid runner and cyclist, competing in the Boston Marathon more than 10 times and regularly competing in triathlons across the USA.​

node.title: Marvin Burman
node.authorbio:
Marvin Burman led the Applause sales organization for over five years as Vice President of Sales Europe. During his time at the company Marvin regularly contributed to the Applause blog. He used his background in product management to write articles regarding product management of applications and websites, and how to leverage SCRUM for improved team proficiency.

Prior to Applause, Marvin worked as Head of Product for Testhub, the leading crowdsourced quality assurance provider for app and web products in Germany. He helped to merge the company when it was acquired by Applause. Marvin graduated from Maastricht University in The Netherlands with a degree in international business. He is fluent in both English and Dutch.

node.title: Nishi Grover Garg
node.authorbio:
In 2017 Nishi Grover Garg contributed an article to Applause on how to find testing meetups throughout Europe. Nishi is a certified SCRUM Master and has over a decade of experience working in quality assurance. She is CP-AAT, CP-SAT, CP-DOF, CP-MAT (certified by ATA), Agile Scrum Master ASM (by EXin) and ISTQB certified (Foundation and Advanced Test Analyst & Test Manager).

She graduated from Punjab University in 2008. Nishi gained experience as a software quality engineer with companies such as Winshuttle and MetricSteam.

She was employed as the Principal Consultant and Chief coordinator of Agile Testing Alliance - Bangalore Chapter, India for three years. Most recently Nishi works as Product Evangelist and Training Head, Sai Pro with Tyto Software.

Nishi has spoken at quality assurance events and conferences such as UNICOM and ATA in Singapore, Bangalore and Pune. She is also a freelance writer on technical topics and publishers her own blog about trends in Agile QA. ( www.testwithnishi.com)

Outside of work, Nishi volunteers with the organization SOS Children’s Villages.

node.title: Roy Solomon
node.authorbio:
Co-founder Roy Solomon leads the Applause team focused on emerging business. He has a passion for innovation and works closely with tech visionaries and global brands of the future. Based on his extensive experience managing QA and testing for global companies, Roy recognized the need for an on-demand “real-world” testing solution – and the Applause concept was born.

Prior to Applause, Roy led QA and product teams at various consumer application software companies like IncrediMail and Blue Security. Roy holds a Bachelor of Science in Computer & Technical Management from the HiT Institute Israel.

node.title: Toby Vogels
node.authorbio:
Toby Vogels is a product manager who has experience working with mobile products. In 2017 Toby contributed an article to Applause about leveraging customer metrics to support mobile product growth

Toby attended UC Irvine and received his Master’s degree in Business and Media Management from the University of Hamburg. Toby has worked as a product marketing manager for companies such as Bookatable by Michelin and Twyxt. He became Director of Product and Growth for DRC. Inc in 2015. Toby would go on to become Mobile Developer Evangelist for Yahoo! Mobile’s Flurry Analytics. Currently, Toby is working as Senior Product Manager, Media Experiences at Verizon.

In his free time Toby volunteers at several non-profit organizations. He is a mentor with Free Ventures. Toby has also been a featured speaker at Product School.

node.title: Neil Lakomiak
node.authorbio:
Neil Lakomiak is the Director of Business Management and Innovation for the Building and Life Safety Technologies at Underwriters Laboratory in the Greater Chicago area. Underwriters Laboratory is a global safety certification company headquartered in Northbrook, Illinois. In addition to providing business solutions, UL operates a nonprofit arm that conducts independent research related to safety improvements.

Lakomiak writes for the UL-sponsored blog Inside UL. He has contributed articles to publications such as Security Distributing and Marketing Magazine and Mission Critical Magazine. Lakomiak has also been a guest speaker at events for the National Retail Federation and BuiltWorlds where he discussed innovations in safety and security technology.

His contributed work at Applause includes the article “Three Challenges to Setting Up the Smart Home” which was originally published in Inside UL. This piece dives into how inoperability, usability, and cybersecurity can be major hurdles to a successful smart home product.
Neil is a member of the Society of Fire Protection Engineers (SFPE) and a member of the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA), International Association of Chiefs of Police (IACP), the Security Industry Association (SIA), ASIS and Infragard

node.title: Daniel Knott
node.authorbio:
Daniel is a mobile testing expert working as Lead Software Test Engineer at XING’s mobile team. He started his software testing career in 2003 as a trainee at IBM. After his time at IBM, Daniel studied computer science with a focus on software development and testing. Since 2009, Daniel has worked for companies such as Accenture, AOE and XING. He is experienced in several mobile test automation tools such as Robotium, Calabash for iOS/ Android, Espresso and Keep It Functional. With the help of this tools, he developed a fully automated testing environment for Android and iOS.

Daniel likes to share his knowledge and therefore he started to share his experience on his blog www.adventuresinqa.com as well as in several testing magazines. Daniel is a well-known mobile expert, a speaker at various conferences in Europe and since 2014, he is the author of the book Hands-On Mobile App Testing.

node.title: Dean Vittum
node.authorbio: As director of QA at Applause, Dean works closely with prospects, reviewing testing requirements and developing proposals to meet prospects’ needs. Prior to his role at Applause, Dean worked as a senior quality assurance manager for a number of companies in various high tech industries, building all aspects of the SDLC and QA teams. Dean brings more than 20 years of quality assurance experience to his role at Applause, and applies it to helping QA professionals benefit from crowdtesting.

node.title: Julien Mascaro
node.authorbio: Leading several testing projects and test teams in the French market, Julien has developed considerable experience as a Test Engineer in various testing methods including Payment Testing and Exploratory Testing. Julien is well versed in testing across a variety of different industries such as transportation, banking, and e-commerce.

node.title: Dan Haggerty
node.authorbio: Dan is Applause’s content and PR marketing manager. He specializes in writing blogs, media articles, whitepapers, and eBooks. He most commonly writes on the topics of omnichannel retail, the applications of Voice and AI, and best practices for mobile app testing. Dan joined the Applause team in June 2017 after content and media relations roles at SimpliVity and Version 2.0 Communications.

node.title: Jonathan Blümel
node.authorbio:
Jonathan Bluemel is an experienced product and content, marketing manager. He worked at Applause between 2017 and 2019 as a Content Marketing and Social Media Marketing Manager in the Berlin office. He dealt with the challenges that companies across different industries from Germany, France and UK are facing in terms of testing, quality assurance and agile product development.

Jonathan graduated from The University of Hamburg. He gained experience in the technology industry as a content and product marketing specialist for companies such as eprofessional, and Ethority. Before coming to Applause he worked as a Junior Content Manager at Engel & Völkers, a real estate company based in Germany. Recently Johnathan has worked as a Senior Content Manager at Plyot GmbH
